result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J. Hake was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE at FTE/schooling/combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours community service per week.

Absolute sobriety from alcohol. 

NO going upon the premises of any bars, taverns, liquor stores, beer tents or any other premises that has its primary source of business the sale of alcohol.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

AODA and follow through with recommendations. 

Anger management and/or SAFE program at the discretion of the agent.  

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department. 

DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: with huber for work/treatmen to begin at agent's discretion.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael J. Hake

records.addlTxt: Marathon County DNA Proof of Submission
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 3:30 pm 
INCLUDES 14CF277, 14CF970, 17CF1433, 18CF495, and 18CF619. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Deft appears in person with Atty Peter Prusinski. 

SENTENCING IN 14CF277 AND 14CF970 ONLY. 
VRCW. 
Argument. Deft makes statement. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT ORDERS: SWH for 5 yrs probation - CONDITIONS: AODA and follow through with recommendations; anger management and/or SAFE program at the discretion of the agent; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; absolute sobriety from alcohol; no going upon the premises of any Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, Beer Tents or any other premises that has as its primary source of business the sale of alcohol; restitution of $84 to F.B. to be paid within first 6 months of probationary period; good faith effort at fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; 6 months MCJ with huber for work/treatment to begin at the agent's discretion; DNA sample/surcharge; CC. 
COURT finds the deft entitled to NO days jail credit. 
State to draft restitution order.

Sentencing hearing on June 3, 2019 at 03:30 pm.

Pre-trial conference on January 7, 2019 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 11:39 am 
INCLUDES 14CF277 AND 14CF970. 
State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer; Def appears in person with Atty Peter Prusinski.  
VRCW in all cases. 

HEARING IN 14CF277. 
State moves to withdraw motion to revoke DEOJ in this file and moves to extend original DEOJ agreement. 
COURT grants motion to withdraw motion to revoke DEOJ. 
COURT extends DEOJ agreement as stipulated by the parties to 3/20/2018. 
COURT signs stipulation. 
Review of DEOJ set for March 16, 2018 at 10:45 am with Br. 3 Judge. 
Bond Continues. 

WAIVER OF PRELIM IN 14CF970. 
Waiver of Prelim. filed. 
Court questions deft as to waiver. 
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made. 
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
Information filed.  Reading Waived.

PLEA HEARING IN 14CF970. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 
State moves to: 
Ct. 1 (False Imprisonment)>>D&RI. 
Ct. 3 (Battery)>>D&RI. 
Ct. 4 (DC/Use of Dangerous Weapon)>>D&RI. 
Ct. 5 (DC)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above
PLEA: Ct. 2 (Felony BJ)>>GUILTY. 
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & defers entry of judgment.  
State makes statement. Atty Prusinski makes statement. 
COURT ORDERS: DEOJ for 3 years with conditions as outlined in written agreement. 
State notes if def successfully completes DEOJ agreement, it will move to dismiss the charge. 
Review of DEOJ set for March 16, 2018 at 10:45 am with Br. 3 Judge. 
Bond Continues.

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 3:33 pm 
INCLUDES 14CF277, 14CF568, AND 14CF970. 
State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Peter Prusinski. 
States notes parties are only addressing sentencing after revocation in 14CF568 and other files are tracking. 
COURT notes motion to revoke DEOJ in 14CF277 and will hold that motion in abeyance. 

SENTENCING AFTER REVOCATION IN 14CF568. 
State notes joint agreement. Deft makes statement. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT ORDERS: On Ct. 1 (Misd. BJ)>>9 months MCJ with huber for employment/counseling/school/military commitment if deft qualifies under jail criteria or electronic monitoring if eligible and payment of court costs with 60 days to pay or payment plan. 
COURT finds the deft is entitled to 48 days jail credit. 

MODIFICATION OF BOND IN 14CF970. 
State notes parties are stipulating to modification of bond in this file. 
COURT approves stipulation of bond - bond is modified to $5000 signature bond with same conditions as previously ordered.
